title: Flipped Learning-Based Mathematics Course for Enhancing Learner Autonomy for Practitioners

context.prior_knowledge: Core middle school mathematics concepts and experience applying mathematics to job-related tasks
context.additional_context: Utilizing mobile-optimized LMS accessible via smartphones, integrated with practical projects.

learning_goals: Learners form self-directed learning habits by completing pre-learning materials at least twice weekly in a flipped learning environment.
Learners improve communication and social autonomy by 30% through collaborative math problem-solving projects with peers.
Learners gain technical autonomy by utilizing digital tools (e.g., calculator apps, graphing tools) provided on online platforms.
Learners write a self-assessment report at the end of the course to reflect on their learning process and propose improvement strategies.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
